fields.summary: Let NameNode to bypass external attribute provider for special user

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
HDFS-12357 introduced a new config 'dfs.namenode.inode.attributes.provider.bypass.users'  to allow configured users to bypass external attributes provider.  However, after committing HDFS-12357, noticed that a different config name  'dfs.namenode.authorization.provider.bypass.users'  is put into hdfs-default.xml, which is different than what used in java code. And this is not correct.

Creating this jira to fix the hdfs-default.xml one to be consistent with the implementation
fields.summary: Rename hdfs config authorization.provider.bypass.users to attributes.provider.bypass.users

comments.body: Thank you very much [~manojg] for helping to take care of this issue.
[~yzhangal], please take a look at the attached patch. Updated {{hdfs-default.xml}} to have 'dfs.namenode.inode.attributes.provider.bypass.users' and it matches with the one in {{DfsConfigKeys}}.
Thanks for the review [~yzhangal]. Committed to trunk and branch-2.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #12815 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/12815/])
HDFS-12404. Rename hdfs config authorization.provider.bypass.users to (manojpec: rev 3b3be355b35d08a78d9dcd647650812a2d28207b)
